The video evidence: The expert would have analyzed the video footage of the incident to determine its authenticity. They would have looked for any signs of manipulation or editing that could indicate that the video was doctored or staged.
Comparison with previous claims: The expert would have checked if similar claims or videos had been circulated in the past. If the same video had been shared before with a different narrative or claim, it would raise doubts about the authenticity of the current claim.
Verification from credible sources: The expert would have sought information from reliable sources such as the Kolkata police or other local authorities to verify the details of the incident. They would have checked if any official statements or reports were available regarding the incident.
Analysis of contextual information: The expert would have examined the surrounding context of the claim, such as the message accompanying the video or any additional information provided. They would have assessed the credibility of the source sharing the claim and looked for any inconsistencies or contradictions in the narrative.
